name: Reina Beta Test
description: Have always ran Noise and wanted to stay with Anarchs. Wanted to be able to cause the corp to pay more to rez ice and me to pay less to go through it. Still debating between Grimoire and Deep Red for my console. Any comments are welcome.

name: Kit Attack  v1.0
description: This is supposed to be a fast attack deck. The idea is to derez the expensive non code gate ice you encounter. I use Chakana in order to slow down the corp a little bit as well. Haven't tested it all that much yet so any opinions are welcome.

name: Scorched Corp
description:
This is based on my previous Reina build.

No need for Imps and Mediums when Keyhole just romps through the R&D. I also found I needed a little more Knight revival, so 2 Pawns went in. Also trying to switch Datasuckers with bishops here. I have to agree that suckers in caissa build feel awkward.

name: Through the Keyhole 2.0
description: I took out kati and pawns for SoT and dirty laundry. Kati was just too click intensive and I often want to be running so dirty laundry worked better. Quality time over lawyer up, 1c more but 2 cards extra without the second click and you can SoT it easier if you have too. Im not in the habit of going tag me so lawyer up was an "obvious" choice that i finally realized was just not worth it. Pawns were slowing me down, there may be a spot for the Scheherezade money trick from homeless Kasparov but I'm not seeing how at the moment.

name: To Derez or Trash?
description:
1. Get Opus
  2. Get Torch
  3. Crescentus or Parasite your way to victory!

name: Spiny Robots
description: This is a work in progress. I think it's purpose is straightforward - create an expensive, dangerous environment for the runner. Ideally you can hit the runner with 1-2 brain damage and really scare them with the snares and shocks.

name: Rielle with max 1 each from Cre/Contr
Paper Cuts 1.4
description: This is the Jinteki deck I've now been running for quite awhile now. I've been able to win a couple tournaments with hit. Basically you ice up your remote and usually R&D. Try not to show your ice if possible until it will do something. This isn't stopping ice. It is slowdown ice. I love starting with a Profiteering and maybe a data mine + chum on remote. Many times I'll also throw three cards unprotected down on first turn including Snare, an Agenda, and an Hokusi Grid or Jackson. Let them dare to run. Maybe even a second agenda if it is Fetal AI. Shock has made this deck even better.If you have 4 credits, 21 of your cards cause Net Damage. Rush to an early lead and get them making poor choices. Thanks to Travis, from my local group, who suggested the Janus addition to the deck.

name: NBN TWIY* Diagnostic / Shutdown - Post True Colors
Sting (Like an Industrial Bee) v1.3
description:
+2 Jackson Howard, +2 Commercialization, +1 Shadow, -1 Caduceus -2 Closed Accounts, -2 Ireress,

This version was developed to deal with some card-economy issues I've noticed. The two Jacksons should provide both the ability to draw into some of my operations / DRTs more quickly, and the ability to re-use played Scorched Earths and SEA sources. Commercialization rewards the corp for advancing the ICE.

One of the problems I am grappling with is that the minimal amount of ICE makes it hard to score Cleaners / Project Atlas with Counters. While this deck is perhaps best played as 'never advance', and then punishing the runner when they succeed, in practice this has never panned out.

I've been playing this deck very horizontally, hiding the agendas amongst assets and traps, and it helps extend the game to a point where I can catch the runner with some damage. I've debating including Shipment from Kaguya to advance some agendas/traps/ice during this phase of the deck, but I'm not sure if this will be enough.

Suggestions / comments welcome.
